hierarchy.entry_domain: Container and Cloud Supply Chain Security

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of relying solely on SOC 2 compliance versus requiring FedRAMP authorization for cloud services in a federal supply chain. Consider cost, rigor, and risk mitigation, citing specific Trust Services Principles or FedRAMP baselines.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, and scaffolding. Generate 20-30 high-quality flashcards on 'CSP Certification Verification (FedRAMP, SOC 2)' in the topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM) > Container and Cloud Supply Chain Security > Cloud Service Provider (CSP) Security > CSP Certification Verification (FedRAMP, SOC 2). Incorporate this research context: [Insert full research context here, including completions: FedRAMP Governing Bodies (JAB: DoD/DHS/GSA CIOs; PMO); Paths (Sponsor-led, JAB P-ATO, Marketplace at marketplace.fedramp.gov); SOC 2 (AICPA, 5 Principles, Type I/II reports via AICPA registry); Verification steps; Comparison table (FedRAMP: gov/NIST; SOC 2: commercial/AICPA); Sources: fedramp.gov, aicpa.org, clearedsystems.com, sprinto.com]. Link to prior knowledge: cloud models, SCRM risks. Use these LEARNING OBJECTIVES: [paste array]. Distribute flashcards across Bloom's levels (4-6 per level), scaffolding LAYERS [paste scaffolding], and ACTIVE LEARNING [reference activities for scenario cards]. Follow FLASHCARD SCHEMA exactly: JSON array of objects with 'front', 'back' {answer, explanation, distractors (for MCQs)}. Ensure 40% MCQs with distractor protocol, 20% process steps, 20% comparisons, 20% scenarios. Cover formative assessments: 2-3 MCQs per layer, 1 scenario, reflection ties. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, e.g., [{'front': '...', 'back': {...}}, ...]. Ensure comprehensive, misconception-proof, university-level pedagogy.
